event.title: 1969, the West Bengal tourism department began

data.event: In 1969, the West Bengal tourism department began the process of acquiring 335 acres of land from the neighbouring Thurbo tea estate.
The work of developing this land into a tourist spot began in 1974 when Siddhartha Shankar Ray was the chief minister of West Bengal.

event.title: was inaugurated by the next chief minister of West Bengal, Jyoti Basu, in April 1979

data.event: The tourist spot, which included the newly built lake and the Day Centre, was inaugurated by the next chief minister of West Bengal, Jyoti Basu, in April 1979.
